title: SpaceX Dragon 2 2018年底載兩名乘客私人圍繞月球一星期

商台同百份keep住領先

https://arstechnica.com/science/2017/02/spacex-says-it-will-send-two-people-around-the-moon-in-late-2018/
...
A launch of 2018 is rather ambitious, however. It requires the oft-delayed Falcon Heavy to actually fly. (The powerful rocket may finally make its maiden launch this summer). Lunar tourism also requires SpaceX to finalize the Dragon 2 spacecraft, as Musk said SpaceX would definitely fulfill its NASA contract and begin flying astronauts to the station before any tourist flights around the Moon.

During the call Musk said he still anticipates the Dragon 2 making a test flight with NASA astronauts in early 2018, and beginning operational missions later that year. However, as a hedge against further commercial crew delays, it's worth noting that NASA is considering buying Russian Soyuz seats for 2019 launches. In other words, NASA isn't very confident in SpaceX's timeline for commercial crew—which calls into question the readiness of Dragon 2 for lunar tourism in 2018.
...
Even though it wouldn't involve a government payload, SpaceX would still, ultimately, need the US government's permission to fly this mission. The Federal Aviation Administration would have to give the company a law license. Michael Listner, a lawyer and publisher of the space law publication The Précis, said that will be no simple matter.

"Considering the high risk of such a venture, the FAA might deny Musk the license," Listner told Ars. "Then there are other factors to include the public relations disaster if the mission resulted in fatalities. Considering the ambitious time-frame of 2018 and the factor commercial crew has not even started yet, it is highly unlikely Musk would get the green light for 2018."

SpaceX的龍飛船上月原定要連接國際太空站，但在飛到距離太空站只有1600米時，突然停止對接操作。及後證實是電腦GPS出錯，飛船自動中止對接，任務被迫中斷，補給計劃要延遲進行。


抄新聞之前做下fact check啦屌
